author: Baha'u'llah
source_text: فيا إِلهِي لَيْسَ لِيْ مِنْ ذِكْرٍ إِلاَّ بِإِذْنِكَ وَلا لِيْ مِنْ حَرَكَةٍ إِلاَّ بِأَمْرِكَ، فَيا إِلهِي أَنْتَ أَظْهَرْتَنِي بِقُدْرَتِكَ وَأَقَمْتَنِيْ لإِظْهارِ أَمْرِكَ وَبِذلِكَ ابْتُلِيْتُ عَلَى شَأْنٍ مَنَعْتَ لِسانِي عَنْ ذِكْرِكَ وَثَنائِكَ.
translation: I can utter no word, O my God, unless I be permitted by Thee, and can move in no direction until I obtain Thy sanction. It is Thou, O my God, Who hast called me into being through the power of Thy might, and hast endued me with Thy grace to manifest Thy Cause. Wherefore I have been subjected to such adversities that my tongue hath been hindered from extolling Thee and from magnifying Thy glory.
